00020 #if (OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0)
00021 /*
00022 *********************************************************************************************************
00023 *                                      ACCEPT MESSAGE FROM QUEUE
00024 *
00025 * Description: This function checks the queue to see if a message is available.  Unlike OSQPend(),
00026 *              OSQAccept() does not suspend the calling task if a message is not available.
00027 *
00028 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block
00029 *
00030 *              err           is a pointer to where an error message will be deposited.  Possible error
00031 *                            messages are:
00032 *
00033 *                            OS_NO_ERR           The call was successful and your task received a
00034 *                                                message.
00035 *                            OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE   You didn't pass a pointer to a queue
00036 *                            OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL  If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00037 *                            OS_Q_EMPTY          The queue did not contain any messages
00038 *
00039 * Returns    : != (void *)0  is the message in the queue if one is available.  The message is removed
00040 *                            from the so the next time OSQAccept() is called, the queue will contain
00041 *                            one less entry.
00042 *              == (void *)0  if you received a NULL pointer message
00043 *                            if the queue is empty or,
00044 *                            if 'pevent' is a NULL pointer or,
00045 *                            if you passed an invalid event type
00046 *
00047 * Note(s)    : As of V2.60, you can now pass NULL pointers through queues.  Because of this, the argument
00048 *              'err' has been added to the API to tell you about the outcome of the call.
00049 *********************************************************************************************************
00050 */
00051 
00052 #if OS_Q_ACCEPT_EN > 0
00053 void  *OSQAccept (OS_EVENT *pevent, INT8U *err)
00054 {
00055     void      *msg;
00056     OS_Q      *pq;
00057 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00058     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00059 #endif    
00060 
00061 
00062 
00063 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00064     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                     /* Validate 'err'                                     */
00065         return ((void *)0);
00066     }
00067     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {               /* Validate 'pevent'                                  */
00068         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00069         return ((void *)0);
00070     }
00071 #endif
00072     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {/* Validate event block type                          */
00073         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00074         return ((void *)0);
00075     }
00076     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00077     pq = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;             /* Point at queue control block                       */
00078     if (pq->OSQEntries > 0) {                    /* See if any messages in the queue                   */
00079         msg = *pq->OSQOut++;                     /* Yes, extract oldest message from the queue         */
00080         pq->OSQEntries--;                        /* Update the number of entries in the queue          */
00081         if (pq->OSQOut == pq->OSQEnd) {          /* Wrap OUT pointer if we are at the end of the queue */
00082             pq->OSQOut = pq->OSQStart;
00083         }
00084         *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00085     } else {
00086         *err = OS_Q_EMPTY;
00087         msg  = (void *)0;                        /* Queue is empty                                     */
00088     }
00089     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00090     return (msg);                                /* Return message received (or NULL)                  */
00091 }
00092 #endif
00093 /*$PAGE*/
00094 /*
00095 *********************************************************************************************************
00096 *                                        CREATE A MESSAGE QUEUE
00097 *
00098 * Description: This function creates a message queue if free event control blocks are available.
00099 *
00100 * Arguments  : start         is a pointer to the base address of the message queue storage area.  The
00101 *                            storage area MUST be declared as an array of pointers to 'void' as follows
00102 *
00103 *                            void *MessageStorage[size]
00104 *
00105 *              size          is the number of elements in the storage area
00106 *
00107 * Returns    : != (OS_EVENT *)0  is a pointer to the event control clock (OS_EVENT) associated with the
00108 *                                created queue
00109 *              == (OS_EVENT *)0  if no event control blocks were available or an error was detected
00110 *********************************************************************************************************
00111 */
00112 
00113 OS_EVENT  *OSQCreate (void **start, INT16U size)
00114 {
00115     OS_EVENT  *pevent;
00116     OS_Q      *pq;
00117 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00118     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00119 #endif    
00120 
00121 
00122 
00123     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                      /* See if called from ISR ...                         */
00124         return ((OS_EVENT *)0);                  /* ... can't CREATE from an ISR                       */
00125     }
00126     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00127     pevent = OSEventFreeList;                    /* Get next free event control block                  */
00128     if (OSEventFreeList != (OS_EVENT *)0) {      /* See if pool of free ECB pool was empty             */
00129         OSEventFreeList = (OS_EVENT *)OSEventFreeList->OSEventPtr;
00130     }
00131     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00132     if (pevent != (OS_EVENT *)0) {               /* See if we have an event control block              */
00133         OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00134         pq = OSQFreeList;                        /* Get a free queue control block                     */
00135         if (pq != (OS_Q *)0) {                   /* Were we able to get a queue control block ?        */
00136             OSQFreeList            = OSQFreeList->OSQPtr; /* Yes, Adjust free list pointer to next free*/
00137             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00138             pq->OSQStart           = start;               /*      Initialize the queue                 */
00139             pq->OSQEnd             = &start[size];
00140             pq->OSQIn              = start;
00141             pq->OSQOut             = start;
00142             pq->OSQSize            = size;
00143             pq->OSQEntries         = 0;
00144             pevent->OSEventType    = OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q;
00145             pevent->OSEventCnt     = 0;
00146             pevent->OSEventPtr     = pq;
00147 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00148             pevent->OSEventName[0] = '?';                  /* Unknown name                             */
00149             pevent->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00150 #endif
00151             OS_EventWaitListInit(pevent);                 /*      Initalize the wait list              */
00152         } else {
00153             pevent->OSEventPtr = (void *)OSEventFreeList; /* No,  Return event control block on error  */
00154             OSEventFreeList    = pevent;
00155             OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00156             pevent = (OS_EVENT *)0;
00157         }
00158     }
00159     return (pevent);
00160 }
00161 /*$PAGE*/
00162 /*
00163 *********************************************************************************************************
00164 *                                        DELETE A MESSAGE QUEUE
00165 *
00166 * Description: This function deletes a message queue and readies all tasks pending on the queue.
00167 *
00168 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired
00169 *                            queue.
00170 *
00171 *              opt           determines delete options as follows:
00172 *                            opt == OS_DEL_NO_PEND   Delete the queue ONLY if no task pending
00173 *                            opt == OS_DEL_ALWAYS    Deletes the queue even if tasks are waiting.
00174 *                                                    In this case, all the tasks pending will be readied.
00175 *
00176 *              err           is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00177 *                            OS_NO_ERR               The call was successful and the queue was deleted
00178 *                            OS_ERR_DEL_ISR          If you tried to delete the queue from an ISR
00179 *                            OS_ERR_INVALID_OPT      An invalid option was specified
00180 *                            OS_ERR_TASK_WAITING     One or more tasks were waiting on the queue
00181 *                            OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE       If you didn't pass a pointer to a queue
00182 *                            OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL      If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer.
00183 *
00184 * Returns    : pevent        upon error
00185 *              (OS_EVENT *)0 if the queue was successfully deleted.
00186 *
00187 * Note(s)    : 1) This function must be used with care.  Tasks that would normally expect the presence of
00188 *                 the queue MUST check the return code of OSQPend().
00189 *              2) OSQAccept() callers will not know that the intended queue has been deleted unless
00190 *                 they check 'pevent' to see that it's a NULL pointer.
00191 *              3) This call can potentially disable interrupts for a long time.  The interrupt disable
00192 *                 time is directly proportional to the number of tasks waiting on the queue.
00193 *              4) Because ALL tasks pending on the queue will be readied, you MUST be careful in
00194 *                 applications where the queue is used for mutual exclusion because the resource(s)
00195 *                 will no longer be guarded by the queue.
00196 *              5) If the storage for the message queue was allocated dynamically (i.e. using a malloc()
00197 *                 type call) then your application MUST release the memory storage by call the counterpart
00198 *                 call of the dynamic allocation scheme used.  If the queue storage was created statically
00199 *                 then, the storage can be reused.
00200 *********************************************************************************************************
00201 */
00202 
00203 #if OS_Q_DEL_EN > 0
00204 OS_EVENT  *OSQDel (OS_EVENT *pevent, INT8U opt, INT8U *err)
00205 {
00206     BOOLEAN    tasks_waiting;
00207     OS_Q      *pq;
00208 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                                /* Allocate storage for CPU status register */
00209     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00210 #endif    
00211 
00212 
00213 
00214 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00215     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                               /* Validate 'err'                           */
00216         return (pevent);
00217     }
00218     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                         /* Validate 'pevent'                        */
00219         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00220         return (pevent);
00221     }
00222 #endif
00223     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {          /* Validate event block type                */
00224         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00225         return (pevent);
00226     }
00227     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                                /* See if called from ISR ...               */
00228         *err = OS_ERR_DEL_ISR;                             /* ... can't DELETE from an ISR             */
00229         return (pevent);
00230     }
00231     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00232     if (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {                      /* See if any tasks waiting on queue        */
00233         tasks_waiting = TRUE;                              /* Yes                                      */
00234     } else {
00235         tasks_waiting = FALSE;                             /* No                                       */
00236     }
00237     switch (opt) {
00238         case OS_DEL_NO_PEND:                               /* Delete queue only if no task waiting     */
00239              if (tasks_waiting == FALSE) {
00240 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00241                  pevent->OSEventName[0] = '?';             /* Unknown name                             */
00242                  pevent->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00243 #endif
00244                  pq                     = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;  /* Return OS_Q to free list     */
00245                  pq->OSQPtr             = OSQFreeList;
00246                  OSQFreeList            = pq;
00247                  pevent->OSEventType    = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00248                  pevent->OSEventPtr     = OSEventFreeList; /* Return Event Control Block to free list  */
00249                  pevent->OSEventCnt     = 0;
00250                  OSEventFreeList        = pevent;          /* Get next free event control block        */
00251                  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00252                  *err                   = OS_NO_ERR;
00253                  return ((OS_EVENT *)0);                   /* Queue has been deleted                   */
00254              } else {
00255                  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00256                  *err                   = OS_ERR_TASK_WAITING;
00257                  return (pevent);
00258              }
00259 
00260         case OS_DEL_ALWAYS:                                /* Always delete the queue                  */
00261              while (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {          /* Ready ALL tasks waiting for queue        */
00262                  (void)OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, (void *)0, OS_STAT_Q);
00263              }
00264 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00265              pevent->OSEventName[0] = '?';                 /* Unknown name                             */
00266              pevent->OSEventName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00267 #endif
00268              pq                     = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;   /* Return OS_Q to free list        */
00269              pq->OSQPtr             = OSQFreeList;
00270              OSQFreeList            = pq;
00271              pevent->OSEventType    = OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED;
00272              pevent->OSEventPtr     = OSEventFreeList;     /* Return Event Control Block to free list  */
00273              pevent->OSEventCnt     = 0;
00274              OSEventFreeList        = pevent;              /* Get next free event control block        */
00275              OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00276              if (tasks_waiting == TRUE) {                  /* Reschedule only if task(s) were waiting  */
00277                  OS_Sched();                               /* Find highest priority task ready to run  */
00278              }
00279              *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00280              return ((OS_EVENT *)0);                       /* Queue has been deleted                   */
00281 
00282         default:
00283              OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00284              *err = OS_ERR_INVALID_OPT;
00285              return (pevent);
00286     }
00287 }
00288 #endif
00289 
00290 /*$PAGE*/
00291 /*
00292 *********************************************************************************************************
00293 *                                             FLUSH QUEUE
00294 *
00295 * Description : This function is used to flush the contents of the message queue.
00296 *
00297 * Arguments   : none
00298 *
00299 * Returns     : OS_NO_ERR           upon success
00300 *               OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE   If you didn't pass a pointer to a queue
00301 *               OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL  If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00302 *
00303 * WARNING     : You should use this function with great care because, when to flush the queue, you LOOSE
00304 *               the references to what the queue entries are pointing to and thus, you could cause
00305 *               'memory leaks'.  In other words, the data you are pointing to that's being referenced
00306 *               by the queue entries should, most likely, need to be de-allocated (i.e. freed).
00307 *********************************************************************************************************
00308 */
00309 
00310 #if OS_Q_FLUSH_EN > 0
00311 INT8U  OSQFlush (OS_EVENT *pevent)
00312 {
00313     OS_Q      *pq;
00314 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                           /* Allocate storage for CPU status register      */
00315     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00316 #endif    
00317 
00318 
00319 
00320 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00321     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                    /* Validate 'pevent'                             */
00322         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00323     }
00324     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {     /* Validate event block type                     */
00325         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00326     }
00327 #endif
00328     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00329     pq             = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;      /* Point to queue storage structure              */
00330     pq->OSQIn      = pq->OSQStart;
00331     pq->OSQOut     = pq->OSQStart;
00332     pq->OSQEntries = 0;
00333     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00334     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00335 }
00336 #endif
00337 
00338 /*$PAGE*/
00339 /*
00340 *********************************************************************************************************
00341 *                                     PEND ON A QUEUE FOR A MESSAGE
00342 *
00343 * Description: This function waits for a message to be sent to a queue
00344 *
00345 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired queue
00346 *
00347 *              timeout       is an optional timeout period (in clock ticks).  If non-zero, your task will
00348 *                            wait for a message to arrive at the queue up to the amount of time
00349 *                            specified by this argument.  If you specify 0, however, your task will wait
00350 *                            forever at the specified queue or, until a message arrives.
00351 *
00352 *              err           is a pointer to where an error message will be deposited.  Possible error
00353 *                            messages are:
00354 *
00355 *                            OS_NO_ERR           The call was successful and your task received a
00356 *                                                message.
00357 *                            OS_TIMEOUT          A message was not received within the specified timeout
00358 *                            OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE   You didn't pass a pointer to a queue
00359 *                            OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL  If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00360 *                            OS_ERR_PEND_ISR     If you called this function from an ISR and the result
00361 *                                                would lead to a suspension.
00362 *
00363 * Returns    : != (void *)0  is a pointer to the message received
00364 *              == (void *)0  if you received a NULL pointer message or,
00365 *                            if no message was received or,
00366 *                            if 'pevent' is a NULL pointer or,
00367 *                            if you didn't pass a pointer to a queue.
00368 *
00369 * Note(s)    : As of V2.60, this function allows you to receive NULL pointer messages.
00370 *********************************************************************************************************
00371 */
00372 
00373 void  *OSQPend (OS_EVENT *pevent, INT16U timeout, INT8U *err)
00374 {
00375     void      *msg;
00376     OS_Q      *pq;
00377 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00378     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00379 #endif    
00380 
00381 
00382 
00383 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00384     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                     /* Validate 'err'                                     */
00385         return ((void *)0);
00386     }
00387     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {               /* Validate 'pevent'                                  */
00388         *err = OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL;
00389         return ((void *)0);
00390     }
00391     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {/* Validate event block type                          */
00392         *err = OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE;
00393         return ((void *)0);
00394     }
00395 #endif
00396     if (OSIntNesting > 0) {                      /* See if called from ISR ...                         */
00397         *err = OS_ERR_PEND_ISR;                  /* ... can't PEND from an ISR                         */
00398         return ((void *)0);
00399     }
00400     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00401     pq = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;             /* Point at queue control block                       */
00402     if (pq->OSQEntries > 0) {                    /* See if any messages in the queue                   */
00403         msg = *pq->OSQOut++;                     /* Yes, extract oldest message from the queue         */
00404         pq->OSQEntries--;                        /* Update the number of entries in the queue          */
00405         if (pq->OSQOut == pq->OSQEnd) {          /* Wrap OUT pointer if we are at the end of the queue */
00406             pq->OSQOut = pq->OSQStart;
00407         }
00408         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00409         *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00410         return (msg);                            /* Return message received                            */
00411     }
00412     OSTCBCur->OSTCBStat   |= OS_STAT_Q;          /* Task will have to pend for a message to be posted  */
00413     OSTCBCur->OSTCBPendTO  = FALSE;
00414     OSTCBCur->OSTCBDly     = timeout;            /* Load timeout into TCB                              */
00415     OS_EventTaskWait(pevent);                    /* Suspend task until event or timeout occurs         */
00416     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00417     OS_Sched();                                  /* Find next highest priority task ready to run       */
00418     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00419     if (OSTCBCur->OSTCBPendTO == TRUE) {         /* Was task readied because of a timeout?             */
00420         OS_EventTO(pevent);                      /* Yes                                                */
00421         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00422         *err = OS_TIMEOUT;                       /*     Indicate a timeout occured                     */
00423         return ((void *)0);                      /*     No message received                            */
00424     }
00425     msg                     = OSTCBCur->OSTCBMsg;/* No, Extract message from TCB (Put there by QPost)  */
00426     OSTCBCur->OSTCBMsg      = (void *)0;
00427     OSTCBCur->OSTCBStat     = OS_STAT_RDY;
00428     OSTCBCur->OSTCBEventPtr = (OS_EVENT *)0;     /*     No longer waiting for event                    */
00429     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00430     *err                    = OS_NO_ERR;
00431     return (msg);                                /*     Return message received                        */
00432 }
00433 /*$PAGE*/
00434 /*
00435 *********************************************************************************************************
00436 *                                        POST MESSAGE TO A QUEUE
00437 *
00438 * Description: This function sends a message to a queue
00439 *
00440 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired queue
00441 *
00442 *              msg           is a pointer to the message to send.
00443 *
00444 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR             The call was successful and the message was sent
00445 *              OS_Q_FULL             If the queue cannot accept any more messages because it is full.
00446 *              OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE     If you didn't pass a pointer to a queue.
00447 *              OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL    If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00448 *
00449 * Note(s)    : As of V2.60, this function allows you to send NULL pointer messages.
00450 *********************************************************************************************************
00451 */
00452 
00453 #if OS_Q_POST_EN > 0
00454 INT8U  OSQPost (OS_EVENT *pevent, void *msg)
00455 {
00456     OS_Q      *pq;
00457 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                            /* Allocate storage for CPU status register     */
00458     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00459 #endif    
00460 
00461 
00462 
00463 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00464     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                     /* Validate 'pevent'                            */
00465         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00466     }
00467 #endif
00468     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {      /* Validate event block type                    */
00469         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00470     }
00471     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00472     if (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {                  /* See if any task pending on queue             */
00473         (void)OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, msg, OS_STAT_Q); /* Ready highest priority task waiting on event */
00474         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00475         OS_Sched();                                    /* Find highest priority task ready to run      */
00476         return (OS_NO_ERR);
00477     }
00478     pq = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;                   /* Point to queue control block                 */
00479     if (pq->OSQEntries >= pq->OSQSize) {               /* Make sure queue is not full                  */
00480         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00481         return (OS_Q_FULL);
00482     }
00483     *pq->OSQIn++ = msg;                                /* Insert message into queue                    */
00484     pq->OSQEntries++;                                  /* Update the nbr of entries in the queue       */
00485     if (pq->OSQIn == pq->OSQEnd) {                     /* Wrap IN ptr if we are at end of queue        */
00486         pq->OSQIn = pq->OSQStart;
00487     }
00488     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00489     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00490 }
00491 #endif
00492 /*$PAGE*/
00493 /*
00494 *********************************************************************************************************
00495 *                                   POST MESSAGE TO THE FRONT OF A QUEUE
00496 *
00497 * Description: This function sends a message to a queue but unlike OSQPost(), the message is posted at
00498 *              the front instead of the end of the queue.  Using OSQPostFront() allows you to send
00499 *              'priority' messages.
00500 *
00501 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired queue
00502 *
00503 *              msg           is a pointer to the message to send.
00504 *
00505 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR             The call was successful and the message was sent
00506 *              OS_Q_FULL             If the queue cannot accept any more messages because it is full.
00507 *              OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE     If you didn't pass a pointer to a queue.
00508 *              OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL    If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00509 *
00510 * Note(s)    : As of V2.60, this function allows you to send NULL pointer messages.
00511 *********************************************************************************************************
00512 */
00513 
00514 #if OS_Q_POST_FRONT_EN > 0
00515 INT8U  OSQPostFront (OS_EVENT *pevent, void *msg)
00516 {
00517     OS_Q      *pq;
00518 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                           /* Allocate storage for CPU status register      */
00519     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00520 #endif    
00521 
00522 
00523 
00524 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00525     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                    /* Validate 'pevent'                             */
00526         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00527     }
00528 #endif
00529     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {     /* Validate event block type                     */
00530         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00531     }
00532     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00533     if (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {                 /* See if any task pending on queue              */
00534         (void)OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, msg, OS_STAT_Q);/* Ready highest priority task waiting on event  */
00535         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00536         OS_Sched();                                   /* Find highest priority task ready to run       */
00537         return (OS_NO_ERR);
00538     }
00539     pq = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;                  /* Point to queue control block                  */
00540     if (pq->OSQEntries >= pq->OSQSize) {              /* Make sure queue is not full                   */
00541         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00542         return (OS_Q_FULL);
00543     }
00544     if (pq->OSQOut == pq->OSQStart) {                 /* Wrap OUT ptr if we are at the 1st queue entry */
00545         pq->OSQOut = pq->OSQEnd;
00546     }
00547     pq->OSQOut--;
00548     *pq->OSQOut = msg;                                /* Insert message into queue                     */
00549     pq->OSQEntries++;                                 /* Update the nbr of entries in the queue        */
00550     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00551     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00552 }
00553 #endif
00554 /*$PAGE*/
00555 /*
00556 *********************************************************************************************************
00557 *                                        POST MESSAGE TO A QUEUE
00558 *
00559 * Description: This function sends a message to a queue.  This call has been added to reduce code size
00560 *              since it can replace both OSQPost() and OSQPostFront().  Also, this function adds the
00561 *              capability to broadcast a message to ALL tasks waiting on the message queue.
00562 *
00563 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired queue
00564 *
00565 *              msg           is a pointer to the message to send.
00566 *
00567 *              opt           determines the type of POST performed:
00568 *                            OS_POST_OPT_NONE         POST to a single waiting task
00569 *                                                     (Identical to OSQPost())
00570 *                            OS_POST_OPT_BROADCAST    POST to ALL tasks that are waiting on the queue
00571 *                            OS_POST_OPT_FRONT        POST as LIFO (Simulates OSQPostFront())
00572 *
00573 *                            Below is a list of ALL the possible combination of these flags:
00574 *
00575 *                                 1) OS_POST_OPT_NONE
00576 *                                    identical to OSQPost()
00577 *
00578 *                                 2) OS_POST_OPT_FRONT
00579 *                                    identical to OSQPostFront()
00580 *
00581 *                                 3) OS_POST_OPT_BROADCAST
00582 *                                    identical to OSQPost() but will broadcast 'msg' to ALL waiting tasks
00583 *
00584 *                                 4) OS_POST_OPT_FRONT + OS_POST_OPT_BROADCAST  is identical to
00585 *                                    OSQPostFront() except that will broadcast 'msg' to ALL waiting tasks
00586 *
00587 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR             The call was successful and the message was sent
00588 *              OS_Q_FULL             If the queue cannot accept any more messages because it is full.
00589 *              OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE     If you didn't pass a pointer to a queue.
00590 *              OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL    If 'pevent' is a NULL pointer
00591 *
00592 * Warning    : Interrupts can be disabled for a long time if you do a 'broadcast'.  In fact, the
00593 *              interrupt disable time is proportional to the number of tasks waiting on the queue.
00594 *********************************************************************************************************
00595 */
00596 
00597 #if OS_Q_POST_OPT_EN > 0
00598 INT8U  OSQPostOpt (OS_EVENT *pevent, void *msg, INT8U opt)
00599 {
00600     OS_Q      *pq;
00601 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                           /* Allocate storage for CPU status register      */
00602     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00603 #endif    
00604 
00605 
00606 
00607 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00608     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                    /* Validate 'pevent'                             */
00609         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00610     }
00611 #endif
00612     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {     /* Validate event block type                     */
00613         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00614     }
00615     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00616     if (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {                 /* See if any task pending on queue              */
00617         if ((opt & OS_POST_OPT_BROADCAST) != 0x00) {  /* Do we need to post msg to ALL waiting tasks ? */
00618             while (pevent->OSEventGrp != 0x00) {      /* Yes, Post to ALL tasks waiting on queue       */
00619                 (void)OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, msg, OS_STAT_Q);
00620             }
00621         } else {
00622             (void)OS_EventTaskRdy(pevent, msg, OS_STAT_Q);  /* No,  Post to HPT waiting on queue       */
00623         }
00624         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00625         OS_Sched();                                         /* Find highest priority task ready to run */
00626         return (OS_NO_ERR);
00627     }
00628     pq = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;                  /* Point to queue control block                  */
00629     if (pq->OSQEntries >= pq->OSQSize) {              /* Make sure queue is not full                   */
00630         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00631         return (OS_Q_FULL);
00632     }
00633     if ((opt & OS_POST_OPT_FRONT) != 0x00) {          /* Do we post to the FRONT of the queue?         */
00634         if (pq->OSQOut == pq->OSQStart) {             /* Yes, Post as LIFO, Wrap OUT pointer if we ... */
00635             pq->OSQOut = pq->OSQEnd;                  /*      ... are at the 1st queue entry           */
00636         }
00637         pq->OSQOut--;
00638         *pq->OSQOut = msg;                            /*      Insert message into queue                */
00639     } else {                                          /* No,  Post as FIFO                             */
00640         *pq->OSQIn++ = msg;                           /*      Insert message into queue                */
00641         if (pq->OSQIn == pq->OSQEnd) {                /*      Wrap IN ptr if we are at end of queue    */
00642             pq->OSQIn = pq->OSQStart;
00643         }
00644     }
00645     pq->OSQEntries++;                                 /* Update the nbr of entries in the queue        */
00646     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00647     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00648 }
00649 #endif
00650 /*$PAGE*/
00651 /*
00652 *********************************************************************************************************
00653 *                                        QUERY A MESSAGE QUEUE
00654 *
00655 * Description: This function obtains information about a message queue.
00656 *
00657 * Arguments  : pevent        is a pointer to the event control block associated with the desired queue
00658 *
00659 *              p_q_data      is a pointer to a structure that will contain information about the message
00660 *                            queue.
00661 *
00662 * Returns    : OS_NO_ERR           The call was successful and the message was sent
00663 *              OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE   If you are attempting to obtain data from a non queue.
00664 *              OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL  If 'pevent'   is a NULL pointer
00665 *              OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL   If 'p_q_data' is a NULL pointer
00666 *********************************************************************************************************
00667 */
00668 
00669 #if OS_Q_QUERY_EN > 0
00670 INT8U  OSQQuery (OS_EVENT *pevent, OS_Q_DATA *p_q_data)
00671 {
00672     OS_Q      *pq;
00673     INT8U     *psrc;
00674     INT8U     *pdest;
00675 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                            /* Allocate storage for CPU status register     */
00676     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00677 #endif    
00678 
00679 
00680 
00681 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00682     if (pevent == (OS_EVENT *)0) {                     /* Validate 'pevent'                            */
00683         return (OS_ERR_PEVENT_NULL);
00684     }
00685     if (p_q_data == (OS_Q_DATA *)0) {                  /* Validate 'p_q_data'                          */
00686         return (OS_ERR_PDATA_NULL);
00687     }
00688 #endif
00689     if (pevent->OSEventType != OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q) {      /* Validate event block type                    */
00690         return (OS_ERR_EVENT_TYPE);
00691     }
00692     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00693     p_q_data->OSEventGrp = pevent->OSEventGrp;         /* Copy message queue wait list                 */
00694     psrc                 = &pevent->OSEventTbl[0];
00695     pdest                = &p_q_data->OSEventTbl[0];
00696 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 0
00697     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00698 #endif
00699 
00700 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 1
00701     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00702 #endif
00703 
00704 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 2
00705     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00706 #endif
00707 
00708 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 3
00709     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00710 #endif
00711 
00712 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 4
00713     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00714 #endif
00715 
00716 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 5
00717     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00718 #endif
00719 
00720 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 6
00721     *pdest++ = *psrc++;
00722 #endif
00723 
00724 #if OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE > 7
00725     *pdest   = *psrc;
00726 #endif
00727     pq = (OS_Q *)pevent->OSEventPtr;
00728     if (pq->OSQEntries > 0) {
00729         p_q_data->OSMsg = *pq->OSQOut;                     /* Get next message to return if available  */
00730     } else {
00731         p_q_data->OSMsg = (void *)0;
00732     }
00733     p_q_data->OSNMsgs = pq->OSQEntries;
00734     p_q_data->OSQSize = pq->OSQSize;
00735     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00736     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00737 }
00738 #endif                                                     /* OS_Q_QUERY_EN                            */
00739 
00740 /*$PAGE*/
00741 /*
00742 *********************************************************************************************************
00743 *                                      QUEUE MODULE INITIALIZATION
00744 *
00745 * Description : This function is called by uC/OS-II to initialize the message queue module.  Your
00746 *               application MUST NOT call this function.
00747 *
00748 * Arguments   :  none
00749 *
00750 * Returns     : none
00751 *
00752 * Note(s)    : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
00753 *********************************************************************************************************
00754 */
00755 
00756 void  OS_QInit (void)
00757 {
00758 #if OS_MAX_QS == 1
00759     OSQFreeList         = &OSQTbl[0];                /* Only ONE queue!                                */
00760     OSQFreeList->OSQPtr = (OS_Q *)0;
00761 #endif
00762 
00763 #if OS_MAX_QS >= 2
00764     INT16U  i;
00765     OS_Q   *pq1;
00766     OS_Q   *pq2;
00767 
00768 
00769 
00770     OS_MemClr((INT8U *)&OSQTbl[0], sizeof(OSQTbl));  /* Clear the queue table                          */
00771     pq1 = &OSQTbl[0];
00772     pq2 = &OSQTbl[1];
00773     for (i = 0; i < (OS_MAX_QS - 1); i++) {          /* Init. list of free QUEUE control blocks        */
00774         pq1->OSQPtr = pq2;
00775         pq1++;
00776         pq2++;
00777     }
00778     pq1->OSQPtr = (OS_Q *)0;
00779     OSQFreeList = &OSQTbl[0];
00780 #endif
00781 }
00782 #endif                                               /* OS_Q_EN                                        */
Generated on Sun Feb 26 21:45:24 2006 for oxf8548_fnlprj by  1.4.6-NO
